Every morsel of food you waste is a cry from the earth for sustainability.
Throwing away food is like stealing from the table of those who are poor and hungry.
Food is precious; wasting it is irresponsible.
When you waste food, you’re wasting the energy and resources that went into growing it.
The planet has enough for everyone’s need, but not for everyone’s greed.
Respect for food is respect for life, for who we are and what we do.
If you can’t reuse it, refuse it. Don’t let good food go to waste.
Reducing food waste isn’t just an action; it’s a responsibility.
Waste not, want not. A small step today can save a lot tomorrow.
